category_description: Settings that filter the data returned by COSMIC simulations

settings.name: binary_state
settings.description: Filter for the final state of the binaries you wish to retain
settings.options-preface: Each binary system will end its evolution in one of three states. Use these options to retain only certain endstates.

options.description: Retain only binaries still alive today

settings.name: timestep_conditions
settings.description: Pick specific time resolutions to print at targeted stages of the binary evolution.
settings.options-preface: This is used in conjunction with the [bse] section value dtp to determine the timestep resolution for printing to the bcm array. See the related guide for more information.

options.name: dtp=None
options.description: Only the final time step is printed to the bcm array

options.name: dtp=1.0
options.description: Use 1 Myr timesteps for all evolutionary stages

options.name: [['binstate==0', 'dtp=1.0']]
options.description: Use 1 Myr timesteps for binaries until they merge or disrupt

category_description: Settings that change how the initial binary population is sampled

settings.name: sampling_method
settings.description: Select which models to use to generate an initial sample of binary parameters at Zero Age Main Sequence

options.name: independent
options.description: Initialize binaries with independent parameter distributions for the primary mass, mass ratio, eccentricity, separation, and binary fraction

options.name: multidim
options.description: Initialize binaries with multidimensional parameter distributions according to Moe & Di Stefano 2017

settings.name: SF_start
settings.description: Sets the time in the past when star formation initiates in Myr.

options.description: For example, this specifies a start time at the beginning of a Hubble time

settings.name: SF_duration
settings.description: Sets the duration of constant star formation from ``SF_start`` in Myr.

options.description: A single burst of star formation
For example, this specifies a constant star formation rate over a Hubble time

settings.name: metallicity
settings.description: Sets the metallicity of the stellar population.
settings.options-preface: COSMIC expects an absolute metallicity (i.e., NOT units of zsun)

options.description: For example, this sets the metallicity to approximately solar metallicity

category_description: Settings that control the convergence of the simulation run with cosmic-pop

settings.name: convergence_params
settings.description: A list of parameters you would like to verify have converged to a single distribution shape when running cosmic-pop from the command line.

settings.name: convergence_limits
settings.description: Specifies limits for parameters included in the convergence_params list.
settings.options-preface: For each parameter specified convergence_limits, the lower and upper limit must be included.

options.name: {'mass_1' : [5, 10], 'sep' : [0, 10]}
options.description: For example, this specifies that the primary mass must be between 5 and 10 solar masses, and the separation must be between 0 and 10 Rsun.

settings.name: pop_select
settings.description: Selects the stage of the evolution at which you would like to check for convergence.
settings.options-preface: This will filter for systems that satisfy the final_kstar1 and final_kstar2 selections from the command line call of cosmic-pop at the following states:

options.name: final_state
options.description: After the full evolution specified by the user-supplied evolution time

options.name: XRB_form
options.description: At the start of RLOF following the first supernova

settings.name: match
settings.description: Provides the tolerance for the convergence calculation and is calculated as \({\rm match} = \log_{\rm 10} (1 - {\rm convergence})\)

options.description: For example, this specifies a tolerance of \(10^{-5}\) for convergence

category_description: Settings that control the random number generation used

settings.name: seed
settings.description: Sets the seed for the random number generator (for numpy.random.seed())

options.description: For example, this sets the seed to 42
